dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 1258 IH: HSA Technical Corrections Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Perry (for himself and Mr. McCaul) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Homeland Security

form.official-title: To make technical corrections to the Homeland Security Act of 2002.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the HSA Technical Corrections Act.

section.header: References to the Homeland Security Act of 2002
section.text: Except as otherwise expressly provided, whenever in this Act an amendment or repeal is expressed in terms of an amendment to, or a repeal of, a section or other provision, the reference shall be considered to be made to a section or other provision of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 (Public Law 107–296; 6 U.S.C. 101 et seq.).

section.header: Technical amendments to the Homeland Security Act of 2002

subsection.text: Section 103(6 U.S.C. 113) is amended as follows:

paragraph.text: In subsection (a)(1)—

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (E), by striking the Bureau of and inserting U.S.; and
by adding at the end the following new subparagraphs:
An Administrator of the Transportation Security Administration.
A Commandant of the Coast Guard.

paragraph.text: In subsection (d)(5), by striking section 708 and inserting section 707.

subsection.text: Title II (6 U.S.C. 121 et seq.) is amended as follows:

paragraph.text: In section 202 (6 U.S.C. 122)—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (c), in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking Director of Central Intelligence and inserting Director of National Intelligence; and
in subsection (d)(2), by striking Director of Central Intelligence and inserting Director of National Intelligence.

paragraph.text: In section 210E (6 U.S.C. 124l)—

subparagraph.text: by striking subsection (e); and
by redesignating subsection (f) as subsection (e).

paragraph.text: In section 223 (6 U.S.C. 143)—

clause.text: by striking in coordination with the Under Secretary for Emergency Preparedness and Response,; and
by striking and after the semicolon at the end; and

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (2), by striking , in coordination with the Under Secretary for Emergency Preparedness and Response,.

paragraph.text: In section 225 (6 U.S.C. 145), striking subsections (c) and (d).
In section 228A(c)(1)(C), by striking section 707 and inserting section 706.

subsection.text: Title III is amended as follows:

paragraph.text: Section 302 (6 U.S.C. 182) is amended by striking biological,, each places it appears and inserting biological,.
By redesignating the second section 319 (relating to EMP and GMD mitigation research and development) as section 320.

By redesignating section 417 as section 416.
In section 422(a) (6 U.S.C. 232(a)), by striking . Except for the law enforcement and related security functions transferred under section 403(3) and inserting and.
In section 423 (6 U.S.C. 233)—

subparagraph.text: by striking subsection (b); and
by redesignating subsection (c) as subsection (b).

In section 425, as so redesignated, by striking subsection (c).
By redesignating section 428 (6 U.S.C. 236) as section 426.
In section 426, as so redesignated, in—

subparagraph.text: in subsection (e), by striking paragraphs (7) and (8);
by striking subsections (g) and (h); and
by redesignating subsection (i) as subsection (g).

paragraph.text: By redesignating section 429 (6 U.S.C. 237) as section 427.
By striking section 430 (6 U.S.C. 238).

By redesignating section 432 (6 U.S.C. 240) as section 428.
By redesignating section 433 (6 U.S.C. 241) as section 429.
By amending the subtitle D heading to read as follows: U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement.
By striking section 441 (6 U.S.C. 251).
By redesignating section 442 (6 U.S.C. 252) as section 441.
In section 441, as so redesignated—

subparagraph.text: in the section heading, by striking Bureau of Border Security and inserting U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement;
by striking the Bureau of Border Security each place it appears and inserting U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement;
by striking Under Secretary for Border and Transportation Security each place it appears and inserting Secretary;
by striking Assistant Secretary each place it appears and inserting Director;
by striking the Bureau of Citizenship and Immigration Services both places it appears and inserting United States Citizenship and Immigration Services;
in subsection (a)—

clause.text: in the subsection heading, by striking of Bureau;
in paragraph (1) by striking a bureau to be known as the Bureau of Border Security and inserting U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement; and
by amending paragraph (5) to read as follows:

paragraph.text: The Director of U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement shall implement a managerial rotation program under which employees of U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement holding positions involving supervisory or managerial responsibility and classified, in accordance with chapter 51 of title 5, United States Code, as a GS–14 or above, shall—

subparagraph.text: gain experience in all the major functions performed by U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement; and
work in at least one local office of U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement.

paragraph.text: By redesignating section 443 (6 U.S.C. 253) as section 442.
By redesignating section 444 (6 U.S.C. 254) as section 443.
By striking section 445 (6 U.S.C. 255).
By striking section 446 (6 U.S.C. 256).
In the subtitle E heading, by inserting United States before Citizenship and Immigration Services.
In section 451 (6 U.S.C. 271)—

subparagraph.text: in the section heading, by striking Bureau of and inserting United States;
by striking the Bureau of Citizenship and Immigration Services each place it appears and inserting United States Citizenship and Immigration Services;
by striking the Bureau of Border Security each place it appears and inserting U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement;
in subsection (a)—

clause.text: in the subsection heading, by striking of Bureau;
in paragraph (1), by striking a bureau to be known as the Bureau of Citizenship and Immigration Services and inserting the United States Citizenship and Immigration Services; and
in paragraph (2)(C), by striking Assistant Secretary and inserting Director; and
by amending paragraph (4) to read as follows:

paragraph.text: The Director of United States Citizenship and Immigration Services shall implement a managerial rotation program under which employees of United States Citizenship and Immigration Services holding positions involving supervisory or managerial responsibility and classified, in accordance with chapter 51 of title 5, United States Code, as a GS–14 or above, shall—

subparagraph.text: gain experience in all the major functions performed by United States Citizenship and Immigration Services; and
work in at least one field office and one service center of United States Citizenship and Immigration Services.

in subsection (c)(2), in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking Bureau of Citizenship and Immigration Services each place it appears and inserting United States Citizenship and Immigration Services.

paragraph.text: In section 452 (6 U.S.C. 272)—

subparagraph.text: by striking the Bureau of each place it appears and inserting United States; and
in subsection (f), in the subsection heading, by striking Bureau of and inserting United States.

In section 472, as so redesignated—

subparagraph.text: by striking the Bureau of Citizenship and Immigration Services each place it appears and inserting United States Citizenship and Immigration Services; and

in subsection (a)—

clause.text: by striking Report.— and all that follows through One year and inserting Report.—One year;
by redesignating paragraph (2) as subsection (b) and moving such subsection two ems to left; and
in subsection (b), as so redesignated, by redesignating subparagraphs (A) through (H) as paragraphs (1) through (8), respectively, and moving such paragraphs two ems to the left.

subsection.text: Title V (6 U.S.C. 311 et seq.) is amended as follows:

paragraph.text: In section 501 (6 U.S.C. 311)—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (8), by striking section 502(a)(6) and inserting section 504(a)(6);
by redesignating paragraphs (9) through (14) as paragraphs (10) through (15), respectively; and
by inserting after paragraph (8) the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: the term Nuclear Incident Response Team means a resource that includes—

subparagraph.text: those entities of the Department of Energy that perform nuclear or radiological emergency support functions (including accident response, search response, advisory, and technical operations functions), radiation exposure functions at the medical assistance facility known as the Radiation Emergency Assistance Center/Training Site (REAC/TS), radiological assistance functions, and related functions; and
those entities of the Environmental Protection Agency that perform such support functions (including radiological emergency response functions) and related functions.

paragraph.text: By striking section 502(6 U.S.C. 312).
In section 504(a)(3)(B) (6 U.S.C. 314(a)(3)(B)), by striking , the National Disaster Medical System,.
In section 506(c) (6 U.S.C. 316(c)), by striking section 708 each place it appears and inserting section 707.
In section 506(c)(2) (6 U.S.C. 319(c)(2)), in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by striking section 708 and inserting section 707.

subsection.text: Section 601 (6 U.S.C. 331) is amended by striking Director of Central Intelligence each place it appears and inserting Director of National Intelligence.

By redesignating 708 as section 707.
By redesignating section 709 as section 708.

by striking (b) Promulgation of initial guidelines.— and all that follows through In this subsection and inserting the following:

in subparagraph (E), by striking ; and and inserting a period; and
by striking subparagraph (F).

paragraph.text: In section 2021 (6 U.S.C. 611)—

subparagraph.text: by striking subsection (c); and
by redesignating subsection (d) as subsection (c).

subsection.text: The table of contents in section 1(b) (6 U.S.C. 101 note) is amended as follows:

paragraph.text: By striking the items relating to sections 317, 319, 318, and 319 and inserting the following new items:

Sec. 318. Social media working group.
Sec. 319. Transparency in research and development.
Sec. 320. EMP and GMD mitigation and research and development.

paragraph.text: By striking the items relating to sections 401 and 402 and inserting the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 401. Border, maritime, and transportation responsibilities.

paragraph.text: By striking the item relating to section 403.
By striking the item relating to section 417 and inserting the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 416. Allocation of resources by the Secretary.

paragraph.text: By striking the items relating to sections 427 through 433 and inserting the following new items:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 425. Coordination of information and information technology.
Sec. 426. Visa issuance.
Sec. 427. Information on visa denials required to be entered into electronic data system.
Sec. 428. Border Enforcement Security Task Force.
Sec. 429. Prevention of international child abduction.

paragraph.text: By amending the items relating to subtitle D of title IV to read as follows:

toc.toc-entry: Subtitle D—U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement
Sec. 441. Establishment of U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement.
Sec. 442. Professional responsibility and quality review.
Sec. 443. Employee discipline.

By amending the item relating to subtitle E of title IV to read as follows:

toc.toc-entry: Subtitle E—United States Citizenship and Immigration Services

paragraph.text: By amending the item relating to section 451 to read as follows:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 451. Establishment of United States Citizenship and Immigration Services.

paragraph.text: By striking the items relating to sections 455, 456, 459, 460, and 461 and inserting the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 455. Children’s affairs.

paragraph.text: By amending the item relating to section 471 to read as follows:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 471. Reorganization and prohibition.

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 472. Separation of funding.
Sec. 473. Annual report on immigration functions.

paragraph.text: By striking the item relating to section 502.
By striking the items relating to sections 706 through 709 and inserting the following new items:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 706. Quadrennial Homeland Security Review.
Sec. 707. Joint Task Forces.
Sec. 708. Office of Strategy, Policy, and Plans.

paragraph.text: By striking the item relating to sections 811 and 812 and inserting the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 811. Law enforcement powers of Inspector General agents.

paragraph.text: By striking the item relating to sections 857 and 858 and inserting the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 857. Identification of new entrants into the Federal marketplace.

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 889. Cyber crimes center, child exploitation investigations unit, computer forensics unit, and cyber crimes unit.

paragraph.text: By striking the items relating to sections 893 and 894 and inserting the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 893. Authorization of appropriations.

paragraph.text: By striking the items relating to titles XII and XIV.
By striking the items relating to section 1502 and 1503 and inserting the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 1502. Review of congressional committee structures.
